alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Hill; Liberty (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 2:48PM MST until January 07 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM FRIDAY TO 3 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Blaine, Hill and Liberty Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory and first Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Friday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM Friday to 3 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
